comments.body:
Estoy de acuerdo con el muchacho, Miren, el Helio G95 Usa una GPU Mali G76 MP4 a una velocidad de 900mhz y es superior al Mali-G68 en términos de rendimiento y de eficiencia, Además de soportar hasta OpenGL 3.2 siendo de gama media, mientras que el Mali-G68 es de gama media-baja, se me hace un tanto absurdo que no se puedan ocupar los Vibrant visuals con este chip gráfico siendo mejor que el mali G68, Podrían solucionar eso?

Me vá mejor el genshin impact en un Helio G95 que en un Dimensity 920

I can agree with this, I also have a Mali-G76, the vibrant visuals not working even though it is a better GPU than the minimum required is quite annoying. I wish they would look at this post and try to get it done faster.
“I agree. On my Mali-G76 device, enabling advanced graphics causes a crash when entering a world, which suggests a compatibility issue rather than performance.”

I've found out soul lanterns and redstone torches already emit their respective colours if point lighting is turned on, but I really wish stained glass would effect the colour of the light. I'm glad someone brought this idea up
Don't hide the options, don't do it like many game companies do

Hi Minecraft team,

I’m using a budget device (Samsung Galaxy A05s with Snapdragon 680) and noticed that the Vibrant Visuals option is unusabled. I’d like to know if there are plans to enable this feature for devices with lower-end hardware in future updates. Thank you for your time and help.
Btw I use Poco f4 or Adreno 650
I hope mojang patch this ASAP Cuz i wanna play with the vibrant visuals too:(
Samsung s20fe (snapdragon 865) sitting with the same problem since the latest update in August.

Same bug on the last playstore minecraft version.
> *Samsung S20fe* *Snapdragon 865* *Adreno 650*
I also have black sky bug and I tried many things but I can't fixed it.
Samsung s21 ultra also affected
Same

I'm experiencing the same issue! My device is a Xiaomi 11 Pro running Android 13. The black sky makes the Vibrant Visuals look really bad. I hope it gets fixed soon.

Update: After updating the game to the latest official version (1.21.121.1) today, the issue no longer occurs on my device. Everything is running smoothly now. Thanks to the developers for their hard work!

It's a great idea, although, Mojang already though of it, here's the minimum hardware requirements:

Android: Adreno 640, Mali-G68, Mali-G77, or Xclipse 530 or higher 

iOS: A12 or M1 or higher 

PC: Running Minecraft on DX12
you better support the vibrant visuals for everyone feedback which has reached 1635 votes
I totally agree! (I’m on Ios too)

Lava could definitely be a lot more "glowy" and it should cast a stronger orange light on surrounding blocks. Maybe take some inspiration from fan-made Java shader packs like Complementary Shaders or BSL. Here are some examples of how lava could best look:
I don't think it should be reflective... Lava irl isn't so neither should Minecraft lava. Plus it just looks strange
Lava is way too red. It should be an orange color like usually but have more bloom/glow.
The lava (as well as fire) right now has a blu-ish tint to it that looks sort of strange. Lava should assume a warmer tone and producer a more intense glow.

I found that the appearance of lava in vibrant visuals didn't communicate its temperature quite as well as it could have. Torches, for instance, seem to have a much higher emissivity than lava. I think if it were less red and more yellow/glowing it might look a lot better. The color contrast on its texture also seemed a bit high.

For me occasionally, the lava looks pink (which is definitely the wrong colour for lava) when I first look at it. I don't know why, but soon after, it fades back to red. I also agree that it should be much more emissive as well to make it look much hotter.
I would absolutely LOVE for the lava to look like how it does in minecraft dungeons. It looks so good

I think you should take a look at the defined pbr shader, especially for caves. They do an amazing job with lava, and I think glowing ores are also a great thing. I think if you could make lava's glowing pixelated like for the others glowings and shadows, it would render very well.

If lava could reach the stage of the Complementary Shaders or BSL with the orange texture and glow, then I think it would be absolutely perfect! (The other comment mentioning these Java shaders is spot on)

Lava is a light source, so I don't understand why it has directional lighting on it? why are some sides darker than other sides?

it should glow and not be affected by directional lighting (or just be brighter than it)

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/35553557116813/comments/35562708788877

The first comment mentioning how lava should cast a strong orange glow as shown in the screenshots of shaders is absolutely spot on as the lava in vibrant visuals currently does not look great mainly due to the fact that it doesn't quite communicate its temperature properly. Giving lava a strong orange glow would be perfect as it would actually communicate its temperature really nicely.
ohhh the lava looks good i really like the glow in my world
The fact that lava has darker sides is super weird, true. And lava should cast a more orangey glow, like in previously mentioned shaders.
It needs to glow a lot more, or maybe be more transparent.

Now that I know where to give feedback, I'm glad I can share my thoughts. Overall, I haven't experienced any bugs, but lava with VV is extremely harsh on sensitive eyes like mine. Maybe tweaking it to be more yellow/orange instead of red and reducing the lighting (bright/dark) contrast help? I'm not entirely sure, but I can't go to the Nether with the visuals on. Hope this helps

more glow is an absolute must because caves and the Nether look the same for the most part. But the bigger problem I have is with Vibrant Visuals now, the lava looks more like Taco Grease then actual lava so maybe redo the texture.
It needs Bloom. That sort of fuzzy glow effect that many community shaders have.
it should look like real life lava except that is blocky.
Make it glow like Java shaders
Hola, la lava debería tener PBR porque es muy pscura
It might also have problems in The End for people with issues with visual stimulation due to the flashing light
Omg I didnt even think to check the end!! I agree!
The nether is way too dark right now. Making Lava glow stronger like Complementary or BSL shaders is the best approach as mentioned by others here.
I'm sorry, random comment, but as soon as I saw THE NETHER in the title I had to vote it..!

We appreciate you checking out the early preview of Vibrant Visuals and providing feedback. The lighting in the Nether and End have been updated as part of the official Chase the Skies update with Vibrant Visuals.

i noticed that too, and i think it is also weird, the moon also visible when raining. I Hope mojang notice this and make the change soon, also give texturepack developer to do something with weather :D
yeah, is it just on pc or all? i hope it won't make it to full vibrent visuals. (and/or switch 2 minecraft)

Weirdly enough they did fix it before, only to revert it back. Even with Vibrant Visuals now being out of beta, it is still an issue, and I think they should have at least kept the rain fog and gray sky.
yes
A fix has been released to change the sky color and lighting when weather events are occurring. You can check this out in current previews and will be releasing in retail soon.
I think they should just add a randomizer for how bright it is when it rains so that we can get multiple rain atmospheres
Mali-g57 mc2

idk bro i play on a chromebook that has the same gpu im rilly sad now cuz i dont have enough money to buy a good pc and for some reason mojang doesn't let us i guess they will add more supported devices soon.
Well, Mali-G52 MC2 really doesn't support Vibrant Visuals I want minecraft.net to fix Vibrant Visuals support
We need vibrant visuals in Mali-G52 MC2 GPU pls that's not bad at all
I want mali g52 mc2 to support vibrant visuals soon

What you're calling “color coded lighting” has already been implemented in the newest version of vibrant visuals!! It's pretty cool if you want to check it out. The soul torches emit a blue glow and stuff. I can't quite figure out with the rest of your post means, but for the enchanted thing the items already glow, and it's adjustable in settings. It's not lighting that affects the blocks in your world if that's what you're asking for, and it would be impossible to do that according to Mojang. Not sure if that's what you were asking!

vibrant visuals does not look good already. light puts a white film over the over saturated colors, shadows jitter between two pixels when its position is somewhere between, the water surface is way to opaque.

 

the thing i see most shaders do wrong is make light sources have colored light. orange light sources should not emit orange light. it's not only ugly but lessens their utility
I believe the grass is a little too shiny, it looks glazed or plastic instead of grassy.
Another block that is too shiny is pumpkins.
I believe some other blocks besides water should have bump maps to make lighting bounce off them more realistically, like planks or bricks.

Most of the blocks in the mangrove swamp were much glossier than I expected. Turning off reflections gave the colors a much more natural feel, and removed the pale sheen from the environment. I'm sure they're meant to be wet with broad leaves, but the reflections quickly outshine the textures.

Like others have said, most of the natural blocks are too shiny. I do think, however, that this is also true for wool. I think compact blocks like iron, gold, diamond, emerald and copper along with quartz should all be slightly more reflective. They're extremely matte, sometimes more so than the grass. Maybe a reflectivity like that of resin?
Foliage should get shiny during rain and a little bit after rain has stopped.

The shininess of blocks looks wrong. It makes all blocks look smooth, which runs contrary to the effect the textures themselves are trying to get across. also, the light in general (but including reflected light) is washing out the textures/colour too much. A green surface that has maximum brightness shining on it should not look like a paler green - it should look more vibrant.

I feel the HDR implementation should take the original texture colour values as being maximum brightness, and take it DOWN from there instead of washing them out. Increase the luminance, sure, but not the white levels!

When you turn ON the reflections toggle in the settings it makes all blocks look white and reduce the vibrance of the blocks and the world. There needs to be a separate toggle for water reflections and block reflections so we can be able to turn them ON/OFF separately.

I believe in my testing. I like the glassy look of obsidian; however, crying obsidian doesn't currently have the same effect, nor have emissive textures for the 'crying' parts. And also, the respawn anchor product of obsidian doesn't either.

I would like to see more apparent reflection in the glass. When you get close up, you can see yourself, all of the mineral blocks, like emerald, amythest, diamond, gold, copper, maybe iron, and even netherite (although that could be more rustic and duller than the others), don't have any reflections or shine currently, and Redstone and its products is not emissive enough. I'm unsure about lapis and coal, which is just coal, but maybe polished blocks like granite, diorite, and andesite have a slight wax-like reflection.

Also, quartz is too

It would be interesting if this also would take effect on tools, armor, and detail textures like the saw on the crafting table, the blaze rod in brewing being emissive, the diamonds on the corners of the enchanting table, and so on..

Particles in some areas, although not blocks, feel they have lost a bit of emission, notably enchanting glyphs, Fireflies, Nether Spores, and basalt delta ash, and on topic, maybe make rain finally less opaque and more transparent.

Regarding new technology, I'd love a depth mapping feature allowing more context with many of the game's blocks, similar to RTX's depth mapping, simply a fraction of a pixel depth to blocks
Metal Blocks shouls be shiny.

From a material standpoint, the grass technically has the correct roughness, but it looks too shiny because what the flat texture is trying to emulate is the fluffy strands of grass. As a whole, a bed of grass wouldn't look that shiny because of all the angle variation of the blades. So, it would look more correct to raise the roughness of the grass.
Metal and other highly reflective blocks should have brighter reflectiveness than the majority of other blocks.
Settings that affects the overall roughness of all blocks could be implimented, if there isn't already.

Glass is the block I find to be not nearly reflective enough, it almost looks like the metal blocks, such as diamond or gold blocks, more than actual glass. If possible, an appearance similar to the ray-traced reflections found in water would be great!

I feel like farmland should be more reflective and wet looking whenever it's fully hydrated, as it looks a bit odd when put next to dry farmland or dirt. And potentially, making it look a bit more bumpy could also help with the "flat" look.
On MC Preview PS4, there is no shininess on grass. Please make it more shiny
On grass some pixels should reflect  others should be dark same for leaves and flowers

I onestly really like the plastic look of blocks: grass maybe doesn't really look like grass but Minecraft is a game made out of cubes with flat sides, I feel like making everything a bit plastic like fits really well the cubes concept and make's everything "cuter" like if it was a toy.

I think it's the same reason why I never liked high resolution texturepacks (especially the photorealistic ones) you end up with the contrast of a realistic or tridimensional texture on a flat face of a block. and since the core of minecraft is blocks I think it should embrace the fact that block's surfaces are flat.

(a bit of a Highmap for the singular pixel is still fine)

I would like certain blocks to have a relief, so that not everything looks, let's say, "plasticized", for example, in the grass or the sand, that they have certain pixels with relief so that it looks like... that it has relief.

There is the issue that the defult settings give everything a hazy and plastic look. While the water and shadows are nice, everything end up being way too bright or completely dull. There is the issue with blocks being too saturated and clean, lacking any detail that they had since it can't be seen. It give the game a look of a cheap knock off.

Gioco giornalmente con altri tre player in un Realm, ognuno di loro in differenti console e differenti televisori: Nonostante ciò, tutti e quattro siamo accecati da come riflette il sole su determinati elementi; specialmente il verde dell'erba, la sabbia ed alcuni tipi di assi di legno. Il problema viene amplificato a dismisura quando il sole è alto in cielo.
Attualmente, personalmente, penso di dover diminuire le ore di gioco o quanto meno tornare alla grafica precedente. Siamo certi riuscirete a patchare, garantendo un risultato meno brillante e più concreto. Buon lavoro!

Hi, I'm not sure if this is the right section for lighting things, but I want to add my bit as well. For the most part, I enjoy VV during morning and evening, but I have a small house that's pitch dark in most places despite being fully lit inside and caving is a stumbling nightmare. Maybe light sources could have a larger light-emitting radius or something to compensate the darker areas? I don't want to have to torch spam everywhere ;-;

I like how the water looks with VV, especially with the reflections in them, but lava is a bit of an issue for me. I have sensory issues and the lava is WAY too bright when being contrasted to nearby blocks like stone or in the Nether (I can't currently go in the Nether without getting a migraine from eye strain if I have VV active).

A lot of the blocks somehow feel flatter now (lava, grass, wood, etc.) and warmer colours especially are extra warm to the point yellow looks more orange/red and my pink pig is somehow red. Another comment mentioned having the "og" (the fancy graphics) colours be the "brightest" then lower brightness from there, and I think that would be good!

One thing I might suggest too is that instead of making nighttime pitch dark, maybe adjust the saturation of colours depending on light level. I've noticed irl that colours are hard to distinguish in low lighting, so many that could be used? At least on the surface? and maybe leave the total darkness for the warden or thunderstorms.

This was a lot of words lol. thx for reading

It does kind of feel like a "poor-man's RTX", doesn't it? Kinda like the realization of a previously hypothetical "what might ray tracing look like on a PS3". That said, it does at least still vastly improve the overall visuals.....IF one is comfortable using the default texture pack, that is.

Personally, I cannot stand the default texture pack. I've never liked it. If anything, the enhancements of Vibrant Visuals only cast what I dislike about it in even sharper relief. I split my time between the "Natural" texture pack and the "City" texture pack (mostly City), where Vibrant Visuals is quite conspicuously unsupported.

I did briefly switch to the default pack, just so that I could experience Vibrant Visuals, and I *absolutely* see the charm of it! I absolutely see what value it brings and what joy it offers. However, for me, with as deep and acute as my distaste for the default texture pack is, the default texture pack *with* Vibrant Visuals, for me, at least, amounts to a massive "net negative" vs City or Natural *without* it.

That said, now that I've had a chance to experience Vibrant Visuals for myself, its conspicious absence on those packs....sorta has the effect of wrecking those packs for me as well now, creating a sort of "lose/lose" which actually substantially dimishes the incentive to play Minecraft altogther. 

So, over the river, and through the woods, to the question I FINALLY get: are there any plans to add this support down the road? And if so, do we know when?
Glass should be more reflective
im afraid all of the not actually irl reflective blocks, stone, grass, wood etc. are all too reflective and the actually reflective things like iron and gold are way to rough

I think certain blocks should have way more reflection that it does rn. Such as iron blocks and other metallic block, glass, obsidian etc. The reflections and roughness metrics just feel sometimes unrealistic

I noticed in the mobile version, there is a big problem where black objects are appearing grey. This was especially noticeable on banners. I turned off reflections and this mostly fixed it, but then it looked kind of purple.

Had to turn off these new visuals, they are terrible. I don't need all the fancy new shiny graphics that looks too realistic. Like, I just love being blinded by the sun's reflection in real life, I wish I could get that in a game.... No! Sorry but the need to continually make unnecessary changes is very tedious and aggravating.
Se reporter
What makes even less sense is the fact that an Xbox Series X can go to a 28 chunk render distance with vibrant visuals, even though it is less powerful than some gaming PCs.

Yeah, I always play with 40 chunk render distance and my main base spot for my 4-year-old world was chosen because of the views! It's such a disappointment that vibrant visuals caps at 24 chunks even though I play on a gaming laptop that can easily handle my standard 40 with the new updates, as ray tracing and shadows are something I wanted in the game for a very long time. It feels like an unnecessary restriction for those of us that actually can run those higher settings. Why not make it so it pulls up a warning letting us know that we should expect performance issues like it normally does, rather than just capping it and restricting all of us despite our technological capabilities? Hopefully they change this in the next update!!
I don't understand the 24 chunk limit at all. My PC can take it.
It’s so annoying, I’ve built a huge stadium and I’m literally holding out for them to increase the render distance, I can’t even see the other side of the stadium. I’m on ps5
Bababoi
Yes I would love vibrant visuals on chromebook I've been trying to get a good shader and this would be good to have

I NEED IT. I saw my brother's screen well playing  Minecraft on our realm and he had vibrant visuals on and it looks so good! The dragon head looks so good and the sun and moon reflections on the water look so good! And the shadows too! I don't even know what the dragon eggs I have would look like if the dragon heads look like that! AND THE NETHER PORTALS! Some items glow too in item frames like ender pearls and redstone dust! I NEED IT SO BADLY! PLEASE MOJANG! WE ALL WANT THIS!
I got really angry went I found out that vibrant visuals is not on chromebook AND nintendo, which are the only two divises that I play minecraft on and I refuse to play on phone
My phone is too old for vibrant visuals so I want this too
My Chromebook would also be able to run vibrant visuals and I would love to have it.
Mojang plz add vibrant visuals we all need it.

DUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I NEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEED THISSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Yeah we need it I really want shaders plus most of our devices will support it and mine would run it like a beast

My family was devastated when we realised it doesn't work for split screen. Genuinely upset. We eagerly awaited the release of Vibrant Visuals, created a new world to experience it, but it didn't work in split screen. There was no pop-up message to explain this,  it's not noted in the settings, it just stopped working. We know many families who play together, but they're probably unlikely to be giving feedback on this issue. Minecraft is a family game too. Please fix this. The Xbox Series X can surely handle it.
It was sad for me too
Yess plis mojang

I can agree that the skies in deserts and mesas are pretty extreme, but what gets me is the sand and red sand! With all the default settings of Vibrant Visuals, the sand and red sand are so bright! I had to mess with the settings so much, even to get it to not hurt my eyes. The lighting levels are great until about noon, when the sun intensifies and the ground gets blinding. Honestly, after some personal preference changes, I like the reflections on the water and the clouds. Just not the sand. If I turned down the brightness, then my house was strangely dark, but if I left it, I hated the sand!
I think it would be nice if the fog was normal during the day, and then it intensified closer to sunrise and sunset.

I'm so sad!

I was so excited to log into my desert world and view it with the new vibrant visuals, however it has literally given me a headache from its brightness. The sand and sky is blinding and blown out, creators have made videos on troubleshooting issues with the vibrant visuals however, I haven't seen anyone so far successfully counter the issues with the desert or mesa biomes. I have spent over an hour adjusting the settings and have had zero success in countering these effects, I love the world I created but it looks like I will have to wait to play on it until these issues are resolved.
I agree, I can't navigate in the nether because everything in front of me is pitch black. I can't even see block textures, etc... because it's all so dark. And the blue fog is a bit overpowering.

The blue fog puts me off so bad, it almost destroys the vibe of the red hellish look of the nether that fancy graphics would have. It also removes the need to increase my chunk distance because the blue fog covers it up anyway. The darkness overwhelms the player and seems so unnecessary in my opinion. I feel like the nether should be consistently lit up and minimal bloom should be applied on lava in the nether.

Looking far out the fog makes no sense ots like half blue and half the biome ur in. The blue is the problem it looks weird. Other than that its fine close up/ mid distance.(make sure you adjust your setting sometimes thats the problem)
Similar in the end, the default brightness is gone, making it too dark.

This is a severe issue in the soul sand valley.

Vibrant visual affects should be based on each dimension. It only makes sense when the atmosphere and visibility is different with each dimension.

Jappa (one of the lead artists of the game) has said that at the moment, the Nether in Vibrant Visuals is completely unoptimized and will be completely reworked once they're finished with the overworld.

We appreciate you checking out the early preview of Vibrant Visuals and providing feedback. The lighting in the Nether and End have been updated as part of the official Chase the Skies update with Vibrant Visuals.

lighting in general should be more color depending including light sources, similar to how RTX works. For example, the sole lantern should give of a blue light rather than the same orange light that normal lanterns give off.

Edit: after more reading and research I found out that this functionality already exists in the form of point lighting however it is ether disabled by default (and I have not found the setting to enable it) or it is not working in the latest snap shots (at least the color portion).

Credit to the first comment on "Dynamic colored light" for pointing out the point light thing

Agreed. I have a base in the desert and it always looks like the sun is setting. Its way to orange-- it doesn't look like classic sand.

 

Top image: Sand in Oak Forest biome; Bottom image: Sand in desert biome
if you meant the campfire has a shadow then yes it shouldnt but if you mean the light source emits light that light cast shadows if a block is in the way please explain    sorry if my english is bad

so looking more into this I found-

 

Under normal lighting a fire will not produce a solid shadow. the lighting required for a shadow is that the fire is under a much brighter light source the itself i.e. if hit directly by the suns light on a non cloudy day around noon-ish.

So in around mid day the shadow of a fire outside should be very faint and wavy mostly almost invisible if not looking for it. cause by the heat of the fire, soot in it and what the fuel source is. but at night there should be no shadow.
Exactly
This would be awesome.
Yes, even using DLDSR 4k on a QuadHD monitor i notice a lot  of aliasaing.  In QuadHD native the clouds are all serrated.

We need anti-aliasing bad on vibrant visuals. TAAU upscaling at 75% works great on 4k 65 inch TV but is way too blurry on 27 inch 1440p monitor or similar you need like 95% upscale that might smooth out the edges or just plain FXAA or similar.
there must be some feud between Microsoft and nvidia
I agree! For example, it would be great if Vibrant Visuals worked with the Travelling Trader map.

Seconded!

I have NEVER liked the default texture pack, and use a mix of "Natural Textures" and "City Textures" (obviously, switching between the two packs, not somehow combining them). I mostly use City. Anyway, I had been following the news of Vibrant Visuals with tremendous excitement and delight, and naturally, leapt at the chance to try it when it became available....only to find that it ONLY works in the default texture pack. 

The default texture pack is so acutely offputting to me that....to my crushing disappointment, and way more than small amount of acute frustration.....I have found that "the price of admission" to Vibrant Visuals for me vastly exceeds the value that it offers, and that, for me, at least, when compared to City or Natural *without* Vibrant Visuals, default *with* Vibrant Visuals amounts to a sheerly colossal "net negative". No thank you!

And that is hugely disappointing that I can't use (or at least can't enjoy using) Vibrant Visuals in its current form when its announcement brought me so much joy and eager anticipation! Perhaps even worse: it actually creates a "lose lose" for me where it's now harder to enjoy Natural and City, knowing what I'm cutting myself off from in the doing. It all amounts to a massive disincentive to even play Minecraft in its current state.....at all.

So please.....****PLEEEEEEAAAAASSSE**** add texture pack support in a future update - and please do it soon! Make it so that I actually WANT to play Minecraft again!

Thank you!
Very much agree, I hope they add this soon

As of version 1.21.100, the Vibrant Visuals are now improved and playable.

  • The performance is a lot better. I now have 80 to 120 FPS with the feature turned ON. It still needs improvements compared to other modern games though.
  • The RAM utilization is now a little bit lower. But still way to high for what the game is.
  • The input delay problem I had is completely fixed.

So thank you Mojang for your work on the feature. Please keep on because Vibrant Visuals still needs improvements

Have just started playing minecraft again for the first time in a few months to be blasted in the face by this new visual. PS4 cannot handle the change and goes beserk. Also the colours are nothing like the promoted photos on google. They are bright neon colours and the textures are blurred out making things like trees look like blobs. Also as someone with Autism, I found the colours to be very overwhelming and distressing. I am not someone who goes into the depths of settings so did not know this was now the default and could be turned off. In my opinion should not be the default but an option instead, especially until it is made to look like the promoted photos where the colours are still muted like the original colours but the sky more detailed and the water crystal clear. And most certainly should not be a default whilst it makes my PS4 sound like it will explode from what is being asked of its performance levels. Also the colours through the fog are even worse. There is nothing clean and detailed about this and nothing like the shaders/texture packs you can get.
Still terrible on PS5. Even after lowering settings it still constantly drops out of vrr range. It's a nice photo mode but that's really all it's good for. Would love for it to be playable as well.

Not gonna lie, a lite version of Vibrant Visuals would be a cool idea for low-end devices that can't really run the new graphics very well. The Nintendo Switch, androids, even older iphones and phones or wtv might actually get the new update without havin their devices explode on them.

I would love that for my laptop. I love vibrant visuals to bits, but the fans get going real fast and my laptop gets really hot when running the game with vibrant visuals on. I would love to experience vibrant visuals in all of it's glory without having to turn to "fancy" graphics mid-game simply because I fear my device is going to melt.
